Description: Body and handle-root sherd of possibly Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: at left of black handle-root, black-figure decoration consisting of part of padded dancer to left (hand, buttocks and part of legs remaining) with left leg lifted back; below, narrow band in added red above black-figure animal frieze (part of feline tail remaining); handle and handle area glazed; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1886,0401.672 and is from the same krater as 1886,0401.673. C.W. Neeft (personal communication) considers that the vessel may not be Corinthian as there are questions about the origin of the fabric.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.1)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 234)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 662, no. 195)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.012) (Phase 1)
